channel.title: Comments on: â€œYouâ€™ve Lost That Guilty Feelinâ€™â€

item.title: By: Logan Young
item.dc:creator: Logan Young
item.description: yeah, i know. but i kinda like "let it be." in fact, the title track was what got me into them in the first place. (although i very distinctly remember hearing lionel richie doing it first and asking my mother why all his songs aren't that good.) the whole order thing really gets out of hand if you start considering releases here and in the U.K. stateside, "the white album" was followed by my fav - "magical mystery tour."
item.content:encoded: yeah, i know. but i kinda like “let it be.” in fact, the title track was what got me into them in the first place. (although i very distinctly remember hearing lionel richie doing it first and asking my mother why all his songs aren’t that good.) the whole order thing really gets out of hand if you start considering releases here and in the U.K. stateside, “the white album” was followed by my fav – “magical mystery tour.”

item.title: By: Kevin Langston
item.dc:creator: Kevin Langston
item.description: Point of order (literally): <i>Let it Be</i> might've been The Beatles' last release, but it was recorded before <i>Abbey Road</i>. In my mind, at least, I much prefer to think of the latter as the Fab Four's swan song.
item.content:encoded: Point of order (literally): Let it Be might’ve been The Beatles’ last release, but it was recorded before Abbey Road. In my mind, at least, I much prefer to think of the latter as the Fab Four’s swan song.
